children.subject: Please contact the department under which the class is listed. Thanks!
Or contact the professor or their TAs, sometimes they can manually add you (I TA INFO 290A).
If we want to enroll in grad classes in a different department (Info School) should we contact senior people in that department? Or does the CS department control my enrollment?

Graduate courses cannot be used to satisfy any major requirements; however you may petition to use a graduate course toward your 20 units of upper division EECS or toward your 45 engineering units. The yellow petitions are available in 230 Bechtel.

I'm not sure how common this is, but your ESS advisor will probably know.

I process the petitions, and it is relatively common for them to approved. It's really dependent on the course faculty and if they teach the course in a way that is as rigorous as an undergrad upper division course.
How often are students approved for graduate courses satisfying the 20 UD EECS/45 Engineering Units? Is it common or uncommon?

I'm not sure if you are EECS or CS, but EECS tends to always use the yellow petition. If you have documentation that a class was approved by an advisor, I would suggest forwarding that to your advisor and verifying if you should also submit a yellow petition.
If you're EECS please email me nicolemcintyre@berkeley.edu
What if you've had previous emails from the advising approving previous graduate courses you've taken will count for credit? Those are fine right?
Do Grad courses satisfy L&S CS requirements?

I have already received several emails from faculty giving permission to undergrads to take graduate courses this fall. If they do not respond, you can trying pinging them after a week. Make sure to write an obvious subject e.g. "Permission to Enroll in EE/CS ___ RESPONSE NEEDED". If they still don't reply, you can visit their office hours in August since you might not be able to be enrolled until the adjustment period anyway. We will still need some form of written permission, so you can bring in something written for them to sign or ask them to respond to the email you sent.

So professors are usually pretty busy,

What if they never respond to our asking permission (+ follow-ups) to take their graduate course?

Undergrad trying to sign up for grad courses

I'm specifically trying to sign up for

CS C280 and CS 294-43, but I do not know the process for undergrads to gain permission to the courses. I've tried emailing the professors but not sure if theres another process I'm unaware of.

history.content:
In the new enrollment system, undergrads cannot enroll directly into graduate courses like before. Please continue to first get permission from the instructor to take the class and then forward the email to Michael-David (CS courses) or me (EE courses). You will most likely need to wait until the adjustment period to be enrolled in the class so that graduate students can enroll first.

If there is a lab or discussion section, please indicate your preference so we don't need to get that information from you. Including your SID number is always helpful!

For EECS students: Please note that graduate courses cannot be used to satisfy any major requirements. If the student wishes to use a graduate course toward their 20 units of upper division EECS or toward their 45 engineering units, they must petition the EECS department and the Dean's Committee by submitting the yellow petition (available in 230 Bechtel).

Thanks!
history.subject: Undergraduates enrolling in graduate classes

If there is a lab or discussion section, please indicate your preference so we don't need to get that information from you. Including your SID number is always helpful!

Thanks!
